--- On Sun, 10/26/08, mercifulrelease <m=
ercifulrelease@...> wrote:

From: mercifulrelease <mercifulr release@=
yahoo.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] New member hello
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
Date: Sunday, October 26, 2008, 6:52 PM






Hi Everyone!

I'm new and I s=
tumbled onto this group after doing some research
online into EVP. I consid=
er myself to be a paranormal skeptic, but I
have heard some very interestin=
g EVP evidence and would like to look
into it further. I joined this group =
because I am interested in
submitting EVP data to some rigorous scientific =
analysis. I'm an
electrical engineer and mainly work in the areas of signal=
 processing
and communications so all of this is extremely interesting. 

I=
 am interested in collecting some of my own data (at some point) by
buildin=
g a ghost box based on Frank Sumption's designs. I am working
from the "Gho=
st Box Notebook" from 2007, but I am having a hard time
getting started. Ha=
s anyone built one of these and are there any
parts lists or more complete =
schematics floating around? I would
appreciate any build help or advice any=
 of you might have.

Regards,

Anna

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV id=yiv1903184360>
<DIV id=yiv1894782167>
<DIV id=yiv1330314073>
<DIV>Hi Anna    I am normally not a greater for the group but I see everyone is a bit slower than normal in responding to a new member.  Welcome.   I am certain others can answer your technical questions better than I so I will not attempt to here.  Let me suggest that you take a look at other alternatives that will allow you to begin doing <SPAN>evp</SPAN> recordings yourself in a blink of the eye and with less than $50 invested.  You can also explore a couple sites where good equipment is available to buy off the shelf that will give evp results.   Here is stuff you might find useful.  You can always build your own as you move along in the process.  I am glad you are with us.  I have some technical questions you might be able to help research...like learning about the frequencies of "their" transmission etc.   but I ll save that.  Ron l</DIV>
<DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"></SPAN></DIV></DIV></DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"><SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225113441_1 style="BACKGROUND: none transparent scroll repeat 0% 0%; CURSOR: hand; BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none"></SPAN></SPAN></DIV></DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"> </SPAN> 
<P class=MsoNormal><SPAN style="COLOR: black; FONT-FAMILY: 'Calibri', 'sans-serif'"><A href="http://paranormalsystems.com/" target=_blank rel=nofollow><SPAN style="COLOR: blue">http://paranormalsystems.com</SPAN></A> R</SPAN>on Ricketts has a Mini Box II that has all the bells a whistles you can want.  Recommended even by Frank S. 
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal>www.<A href="http://ufogeek.com/" target=_blank rel=nofollow><SPAN class=yshortcuts id=lw_1225113711_9><FONT color=#003399>UFOGeek.com</FONT></SPAN></A> definitely check this out because Mike Coletta (a member) shows you how to hack all the radio shack radios so they can be used for EVP.  They work fine and can cost less that $25.   
<P class=MsoNormal>  
<P class=MsoNormal><A href="http://www.digitaldowsing/">www.digitaldowsing</A>. com ---Bill sells The ovilus, a portable hand-held unit and the Puck a computer based unit.  Uses speakjet computer generated sounds.<BR>buy.<BR></DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal>Then there is EVP Maker w/allophone file at <A href="http://www.keyportparanormal.%20com/evpsoftware.%20html" target=_blank rel=nofollow><FONT color=#003399>http://www.keyportparanormal. com/evpsoftware. html</FONT></A>    This I believe is free to download to your computer and is a proven system for EVP.  </DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal> </DIV>
<P class=MsoNormal>Hope this helps.  Personally, I like the Radio Shack 125 as a starter.  Proven by many here.  I have an Ovilus, Evpmaker and just ordered the Mini Box II.  Good luck.   ron l</DIV>

<DIV>Hi Everyone!<BR><BR>I'm new and I stumbled onto this group after doing some research<BR>online into EVP. I consider myself to be a paranormal skeptic, but I<BR>have heard some very interesting EVP evidence and would like to look<BR>into it further. I joined this group because I am interested in<BR>submitting EVP data to some rigorous scientific analysis. I'm an<BR>electrical engineer and mainly work in the areas of signal processing<BR>and communications so all of this is extremely interesting. <BR><BR>I am interested in collecting some of my own data (at some point) by<BR>building a ghost box based on Frank Sumption's designs. I am working<BR>from the "Ghost Box Notebook" from 2007, but I am having a hard time<BR>getting started. Has anyone built one of these and are there any<BR>parts lists or more complete schematics floating around? I would<BR>appreciate any build help or advice any of you might
 have.<BR><BR>Regards,<BR><BR>Anna<BR><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></DIV></td></tr></table><br>
